page.title: 17Eglingham C.E.First School.
page.content: The present school was built in{1868 to replace a single classroom school, still standing. It was built in sandstone mined from local quarries. The land and building were donated{for {the education of the children of {Eglingham parish.}When the school at nearby{Old Bewick}closed the children amalgamated at Eglingham, attending until starting work at fourteen years. There were sometimes over one hundred pupils in the two class rooms. Numbers gradually decreased and the system changed so that children left at eleven for senior schools elsewhere In{1981}there was another change to the present system of from five to nine years, after which pupils go to Middle schools in Alnwick or Wooler. Currently there are nineteen children, two teachers, a cook to provide meals, a part-time secretary and a cleaner.
